feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 10:11AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...KENNICOTT GLACIER DAMMED HIDDEN LAKE RELEASING... Hidden Lake, which is dammed by the Kennicott Glacier, has begun to release and may cause a significant rise on the Kennicott River at McCarthy. The Kennicott River water level prior to the release was 1342.5 ft, gage datum, on the river gage. Expect water levels on the Kennicott River to rise an additional

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 8:39AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: …High water on the Tanana River into the Weekend… The Tanana River is running near bankfull at some locations between Tok and Manley Hot Springs. This is the result of a combination of heavy rain and recent warm weather causing significant snowmelt and glacial runoff. Water levels on the Tanana River are expected to gradually fall some over the next few
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Flood Statement issued July 14 at 7:51AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH 11 AM... WHAT...Minor flooding resulting from Heavy Rain. WHERE...American Samoa WHEN...Through 11 AM IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall and runoff may cause elevated stream and drainage ditch levels. Ponding may occur on roads and low lying areas.

entry.title: High Surf Warning issued July 14 at 7:11AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Surf Warning remains in effect... * WHAT...Dangerously large breaking waves of more than 15 feet will impact west, south and east facing shores exposed to the large southerly swells and strong tradewinds. * WHERE...All Islands of American Samoa. * WHEN...through Friday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued July 14 at 3:00AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A Wind Advisory remains in effect... * Breezy trade winds with higher gusts is expected to continue to impact the islands today... * TIMING...through Saturday * IMPACTS...Expect possible downed tree limbs as well as shifting of loose and unsecured small objects due to strong winds. Gusty

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 12:07PM MST until July 14 at 1:30PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE PIPELINE BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 1204 PM MST, Emergency management flash flooding and debris flow near the Pipeline Burn Scar. Radar and rain gauge data has indicated up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. Portions of U.S. Highway 89 are closed due to 8 inches of flowing water and debris.

entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued July 14 at 12:15PM PDT until July 16 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong winds with low RH possible Saturday... .An upper level trough will approach the region Saturday into Sunday. This will bring increased winds Saturday afternoon, and possibly Sunday afternoon, that will combine with very low relative humidities resulting in possible critical fire weather conditions. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH

entry.title: Coastal Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 1:41AM PDT until July 15 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...KING TIDES WILL CAUSE MINOR COASTAL FLOODING AT LOW LYING SPOTS DURING HIGH TIDE LATE EACH NIGHT THIS WEEK... .The highest astronomical tides of the year, commonly referred to as the King Tides, will again impact the coast and bayshore each night this week through late Thursday night and have historically resulted in the localized flooding of specific low lying areas
entry.cap:areaDesc: North Bay Interior Valleys; San Francisco; San Francisco Bay Shoreline

entry.title: Excessive Heat Warning issued July 14 at 4:28AM MDT until July 15 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with temperatures up to 99-103. Overnight temperature will only recover to the mid 70s to near 80 degrees, especially over the urban landscapes. * WHERE...Northern Wasatch Front, Salt Lake Valley, Tooele and
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Box Elder County; Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains; Northern Wasatch Front; Salt Lake Valley; Tooele and Rush Valleys

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued July 14 at 4:28AM MDT until July 15 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Temperatures up to 99, with overnight temperatures only dropping into the mid 70s, especially over urban landscapes. * WHERE...Utah Valley. * WHEN...Until midnight MDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses to occur.

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued July 14 at 10:26AM AST until July 16 at 6:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM AST THIS EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected due to breaking waves of 6 to 8 feet. * WHERE...San Juan and Vicinity, Culebra and Saint Croix. * WHEN...From this evening through Saturday afternoon.
